main.sprites.powerups

Interface Powerup

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Fries, ImmunityStar, Powerface

    public interface Powerup
    Name: Jaskaranbir Dhillon
    Date: Thursday, April 22, 2016
    Class Description:

    Interface which must be implemented by every Powerup in game. All Powerups must also be added to POWERS ArrayList in SpriteHandler class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean completeCycle()
      Check whether the powerup has completed cycle (by getting consumed by player or falling into pit, if its motion powerup).
      boolean getPowerupConsumedStats()
      Check if powerup was consumed by player (mario).
      javafx.scene.shape.SVGPath getSpriteBounds() 
      javafx.scene.shape.SVGPath[] getSpriteBoundsArray()
      Returns the Array containing SVGPath Collision Data of Powerup.
      javafx.scene.image.ImageView getSpriteFrame() 
      void update()
      Powerup Logic.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        void update()
        Powerup Logic. Executed by GameLoop class.

      • completeCycle

        boolean completeCycle()
        Check whether the powerup has completed cycle (by getting consumed by player or falling into pit, if its motion powerup).
        Returns:
        True if the powerup has completed cycle, else False.

      • getPowerupConsumedStats

        boolean getPowerupConsumedStats()
        Check if powerup was consumed by player (mario).
        Returns:
        True if consumed, otherwise False.

      • getSpriteFrame

        javafx.scene.image.ImageView getSpriteFrame()
        Returns:
        ImageView containing powerup image on stage.

      • getSpriteBoundsArray

        javafx.scene.shape.SVGPath[] getSpriteBoundsArray()
        Returns the Array containing SVGPath Collision Data of Powerup. The element-specific data is as follows:
        Element 0: Top
        Element 1: Right
        Element 2: Bottom
        Element 3: Left
        Element 4: Hit Box
        Any more consecutive arrays would contain special condition-specific collision data (if any). It is possible for members of array to be null (for example, if you only need to check for top and right collisions, make others null).
        Returns:
        Array containing collision data for powerup. Returns null if Powerup is a stationary sprite.

      • getSpriteBounds

        javafx.scene.shape.SVGPath getSpriteBounds()
        Returns:
        Collision data for powerup. Returns null if the powerup is a motion sprite.
